Portal - The most popular puzzle game from Valve. We find ourselves in the laboratory of the company Aperture where we need to pass the maps in the form of puzzles, but not simple puzzles! Here you are given a Portal Gun (A weapon with which you create a portal on the other side) with which you must pass different types of puzzles with different difficulty. But this is not just a puzzle game, but a game with a whole plot that turns around us! We are one of the test subjects of the PortalGun technology, which must pass all the puzzles generated by the GLADOS computer, but GLADOS is not just a computer, but an Artificial Intelligence (AI) that will accompany us throughout the game...
Principe de jeu génial, je n'y avait jamais joué depuis sa sortie malgré les recommandations de mes amis. À ce prix aujourd'hui dans un pack, ce serai dommage de s'en priver

Portal è, a parer mio, un gioco dalle meccaniche interessantissime. Un gioco degno di questo nome. La grafica, sarò il primo ad ammetterlo, non è un granchè. I puzzle sono semplici al punto giusto (non richiedono 2 ore di pianificazione ma nemmeno 2 minuti soli, fa eccezzione le camere tutorial). Cosa anch'essa interessante [spoiler]sono le radio nascoste da recuperare e portare in determinati punti[/spoiler]. Le challenge sono, a parer mio, abbastanza difficili. Idem per le camere da test avanzate. Una cosa però: il gioco è un pò corto
In breve, questo è un bel gioco, lo consiglio a chiunque piaccia questo genere.

Mi scuso per eventuali errori.

Portal, despite being released in 2007, is a fun puzzle game that can still be enjoyed today. It has a plot that gives you a rough idea of what's going on but doesn't intrude on the cool gameplay too much. You play as Chell, who is testing the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device for Aperture Science, however the situation is not as it first seems. Using the 'Portal Gun' you play through a variety of levels as you explore the lab. The portal mechanics are mind-blowing to those who haven't played with them before and as a result this is a game like no other.

I give this game a 9.5/10 rating. My only issue with this game was that my R9 390 rendered 1000's of frames during the loading screens for no particular reason. Horrible screeching noise. Apart from that, Portal was a very fun game to play and I would recommend buying it if you like puzzle games and/or the game is on sale.

The concept is simple but brilliant: you're trapped in the labs of Aperture Science and you have to get out. To assist you you're given a portal gun. The gun opens doorways in almost any surface. Once you have full control of the gun you can create blue and amber portals. Step into the blue one and you emerge from the amber one, step into the amber one and you emerge from the blue one. By positioning the portals in certain ways you can step, jump, or fall huge distances. You can also use them to redirect lasers and bullets, which you must do in order to stay alive, although the game can be completed within a few hours, and the scenery is quite sparse. Nearly everything that GLaDOS says is absolutely hilarious, and the challenges are fun and really challenge you to think. Additionally, they can be completed in several different ways and it is possible to pick up awards for doing certain things, so the game can easily be replayed with great satisfaction.

Portal is one of those classic games that came out so ahead of its time. It's one of those games that most people nowadays will have it stored away in the darkest recesses of their Steam library, bought and forgotten during some Steam sale. That's my story anyway. 

I tried not to play the game because I hate puzzlers. I hate looking up guides to get past certain objectives if they're too difficult and I hate not being able to solve it myself. So, for the longest time, I didn't play it. 

But this is a different kind of puzzler. It's driving factor and it's most prized possession is the Portal gun that allows you to cross miles in a fraction of a second. You might think that you can go wherever you please with the gun but the level design will bar many areas with clever placement of platforms or unplaceable walls. 

The puzzles start off rather easy as most puzzlers do just to get you acquainted with the controls and mechanics. Once you start moving out, however, the game ratchets up the difficulty. You'll breeze through most of the beginning and then start spending quarter of an hour or half an hour or maybe even a full hour trying to figure out just ONE segment. Maybe you've already figured it out but just can't execute it. I can't tell you how far I came to looking up a guide for one part (but thankfully, I did not). 

And of course, who doesn't love the sarcastic, witty, devilishly gorgeous GLaDOS, the narrator and later found out to be [spoiler] the villain [/spoiler] of the game? You get hints of the evilness of the facility throughout the game with etchings and messages written on plaster wall behind the nice, clean white walls that you are accustomed to. 

If you haven't played it yet, give it a try. Whether you're a puzzler natural or a filthy casual to the puzzle-game scene, I'm sure you'll enjoy the game.

I don't think there are many things that haven't been said about Portal, so let me keep it simple:

The game is relatively short and has a medicore replay-factor. Nevertheless, the several hours you invest in playing this gem are really worth the price (at least in a sale). Everyone in the PC Master Race should own this. 

Even if you're not into puzzles that much, the great humor still makes it playworthy. I highly recommend it

Resumindo em uma palavra: genial! 

Diferente de tudo que você já viu, o jogo é super inteligente e cativante. A Glados é uma figura, um exemplo de personagem bem feito, daqueles que deixam saudade quando o jogo acaba. E a jogabilidade entretem por horas, sem ficar repetitiva. Além de ser simples o suficiente que mesmo que nunca jogou na vida, vai estar fera em 30 minutos.

Provavelmente a compra mais certa do Steam hoje. Não importa se você gosta de FPS, RTS, MMO, SIM... Simplesmente não tem um que não se divirta jogando Portal.

Спустя стольких лет после выхода игры, я наконец то со второго раза полностью прошел ее. Игра конечно супер это и так понятно, вся фишка с порталами просто удивительна и необычна. Здесь нет никаких врагов кроме туреллей, поэтому есть достаточно времени неспеша все обглядеть и изучить уровень, что бы пройти его максимально легко! Сами головоломки в игре не отличаются высокой сложностью, проходятся они довольно быстро и без затруднений, разве что лично у меня на 18 и 19 уровнях иногда возникали загвозгдки и дабы не ломать голову я обратился к статье прохожденя игры. Вот бонусные уровни действительно сложные: камеры с усиленной сложностью, где уровни слегка изменены, что бы ограничить игрока в действиях, а так же предлагаются те же самые уровни, но уже для их прохождения от игрока требуется совершить минимум   шагов/порталов или же пройти за минимальное колличество времени! Вот именно эти уровни составляют по моему мнению всю основу игры, что называется сложнейшей головоломкой! Визуально игра даже спустя стольких лет никак не напрягает, цвета в игре мягкие и приятные глазу, уровни тоже весьма приятно сделаны, и конечно же наличие неплохого сюжета делают ее одной из лучших игр от Вэлв. 10/10.
难度不大，关卡也不是很多，但是很有创意，也很耐玩。通关后一首Still Alive，再回顾一下整个游戏的剧情和过程，确实感触很多。算得上是经典之作。

from what i got from my first run of the game. it basically was a puzzle platformer with minimum combat involving the inovative mechanic of the portal gun. and it is rather neat but no big deal, the envoirments aren't very memorable
[spoiler]besides of the rat man sections[/spoiler]
the enemies you "fight" against are only turrets and a rocket launcher.
[spoiler]although the turrets are actually pretty adorable, it is also symbolic in the story[/spoiler]
and the game in general is actually pretty short, lasting about 2 hours per run and some extra maps.
but here is the thing.
there is a reason behind the game being that short, its because it is all leading up for the final level and oh boy.
what a twist. (from now on i'll turn the spoiler filter for the rest of the review)
[spoiler] as soon as you leave the 18'nth chamber the game changes...rather drastically actually.[/spoiler]
[spoiler]suddenly you find yourself going through different envoirments, and they are the sickest thing[/spoiler]
[spoiler]the game gets funnier, clever and follows a really subtle running gag involving lies[/spoiler]
[spoiler]and then it starts using all sorts of symbolisms and weird things to keep you guessing what's going to[/spoiler]
[spoiler]happen next. and from what i got besides of some other things im not even going to spoil inside[/spoiler]
[spoiler]the spoiler filter, is that the ending was soppoused to make up for a game that actually was preety good[/spoiler]
[spoiler]in itself, now go and feel proud for gabe and buy this game[/spoiler]

PS:每日建议游戏时间1小时，玩久了真的会晕3D，特别是有些需要信仰之跃的地方。
